Uses of Class
org.apache.calcite.avatica.server.HttpServer.Builder

  • Packages that use HttpServer.Builder 
    Package Description
    org.apache.calcite.avatica.server
    Avatica server that listens for HTTP requests.

    • Uses of HttpServer.Builder in org.apache.calcite.avatica.server

      Methods in org.apache.calcite.avatica.server that return HttpServer.Builder 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static <T> HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.newBuilder()
      Creates a typed Builder for Server customization.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withAutomaticLogin(File keytab)
      Sets a keytab to be used to perform a Kerberos login automatically (without the use of JAAS).
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withBasicAuthentication(String properties, String[] allowedRoles)
      Configures the server to use HTTP Basic authentication.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withCustomAuthentication(AvaticaServerConfiguration config)
      Configures the server to use CUSTOM authentication mechanism, which can allow users to combine benefits of multiple auth methods.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withDigestAuthentication(String properties, String[] allowedRoles)
      Configures the server to use HTTP Digest authentication.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withHandler(AvaticaHandler handler)
      Sets an AvaticaHandler directly on the builder.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withHandler(Service service, Driver.Serialization serialization)
      Sets the Service and Driver.Serialization information necessary to construct the appropriate AvaticaHandler.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withImpersonation(DoAsRemoteUserCallback remoteUserCallback)
      Sets a callback implementation to defer the logic on how to run an action as a given user and if the action should be permitted for that user.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withMaxHeaderSize(int maxHeaderSize)
      Configures the maximum size, in bytes, of an HTTP header that the server will read.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withMetricsConfiguration(MetricsSystemConfiguration<?> metricsConfig)
      Sets the given configuration to enable metrics collection in the server.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withPort(int port) 
      HttpServer.Builder HttpServer.Builder.withRemoteUserExtractor(RemoteUserExtractor remoteUserExtractor)
      Sets a callback implementation to defer the logic on how to use the right remoteUserExtractor to extract remote user.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withServerCustomizers(List<ServerCustomizer<T>> serverCustomizers, Class<T> clazz)
      Adds customizers to configure a Server before startup.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withSpnego(String principal)
      Configures the server to use SPNEGO authentication.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withSpnego(String principal, String realm)
      Configures the server to use SPNEGO authentication.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withSpnego(String principal, String[] additionalAllowedRealms)
      Configures the server to use SPNEGO authentication.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withSpnego(String principal, String realm, String[] additionalAllowedRealms)
      Configures the server to use SPNEGO authentication.
      HttpServer.Builder<T> HttpServer.Builder.withTLS(File keystore, String keystorePassword, File truststore, String truststorePassword)
      Configures the server to use TLS for wire encryption.
